SUGAR LAND, TX--(Marketwired - Mar 2, 2016) - Researched by Industrial Info Resources (Sugar Land, Texas) -- The annual Cleveland Auto Show opened its doors this past Friday as the booming automotive sector provides consumers with a glimpse of the future. The Cleveland show, which began in 1903, is the first major auto show to take place following the annual Detroit Auto show in January. The show runs from Friday, February 26, through Sunday, March 6, and highlights a sector that is expected to see more than $12 billion in capital and maintenance projects begin construction this year in the U.S., with $1.5 billion of those projects occurring in Ohio itself. Within this article: Major automotive projects in the U.S., including those by Ford Motor Company (NYSE:F), General Motors Corporation (GM) and Tesla Motors Incorporated (TSLA).
